name: Dogs Trust
membership: Dogs Trust runs the EU Dog & Cat Alliance, which was launched in October 2014. This is an alliance of dog and cat welfare organisations from across the EU, which is registered on the Transparency Register separately.
goal:
Dogs Trust is the UK’s largest dog welfare charity with a network of 20 rehoming centres across the UK and one in Ireland, through which nearly 15,000 stray and abandoned dogs are cared for each year. Dogs Trust invests significant resources in education and the promotion of responsible dog ownership and works internationally to promote dog welfare issues. Dogs Trust has a non-destruction policy and never puts a healthy dog down.

As a charity, Dogs Trust receives no government funding and relies solely on donations.
interests: Agriculture and Rural Development, Consumers, Education and training, Food Safety, Public Health, Research and innovation, Single market, Transport
euInitiatives:
